trans-unit.source: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (PhraseList elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (PhraseList elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.

trans-unit.source: Dynamically modify VCD phrase lists
trans-unit.target: Dynamically modify VCD phrase lists

trans-unit.target: Dynamically modify VCD phrase lists

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands
trans-unit.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands

trans-unit.source: VCD elements and attributes v1.2
trans-unit.target: VCD elements and attributes v1.2

trans-unit.source: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (**PhraseList** elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to access and update the list of supported phrases (**PhraseList** elements) in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file using the speech recognition result at run time.

trans-unit.source: Dynamically modifying a phrase list at run time can be useful if the voice command is specific to a task involving some kind of user-defined favorites or transient app data.
trans-unit.target: Dynamically modifying a phrase list at run time can be useful if the voice command is specific to a task involving some kind of user-defined favorites or transient app data.

trans-unit.source: For example, let's say you have a travel app where users can enter destinations, and you want users to be able to start the app by saying the app name followed by "Show trip to <destination>".
trans-unit.target: For example, let's say you have a travel app where users can enter destinations, and you want users to be able to start the app by saying the app name followed by "Show trip to <destination>".

trans-unit.source: You don't need to create a separate **ListenFor** element for each possible destination.
trans-unit.target: You don't need to create a separate **ListenFor** element for each possible destination.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you can dynamically populate **PhraseList** at run time with the destinations created by the user.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you can dynamically populate **PhraseList** at run time with the destinations created by the user.

trans-unit.source: In the **ListenFor** element itself, you could specify something like: `<ListenFor> Show trip to {destination} </ListenFor>`, where "destination" is the value of the **Label** attribute for the **PhraseList**.
trans-unit.target: In the **ListenFor** element itself, you could specify something like: `<ListenFor> Show trip to {destination} </ListenFor>`, where "destination" is the value of the **Label** attribute for the **PhraseList**.

trans-unit.source: For more info about **PhraseList** and other VCD elements, see the [**VCD elements and attributes v1.2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) reference.
trans-unit.target: For more info about **PhraseList** and other VCD elements, see the [**VCD elements and attributes v1.2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) reference.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: This topic builds on [Launch a foreground app with voice commands in Cortana](launch-a-foreground-app-with-voice-commands-in-cortana.md).
trans-unit.target: This topic builds on [Launch a foreground app with voice commands in Cortana](launch-a-foreground-app-with-voice-commands-in-cortana.md).

trans-unit.source: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named **Adventure Works**.
trans-unit.target: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named **Adventure Works**.

trans-unit.source: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.
trans-unit.target: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.

trans-unit.source: Create your first app
trans-unit.target: Create your first app

trans-unit.target: Learn about events with [Events and routed events overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185584)

trans-unit.source: User experience guidelines:
trans-unit.target: User experience guidelines:

trans-unit.source: See [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for info about how to integrate your app with **Cortana** and [Speech design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn596121) for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.
trans-unit.target: See [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for info about how to integrate your app with **Cortana** and [Speech design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn596121) for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.

trans-unit.source: Identify the command
trans-unit.target: Identify the command

trans-unit.source: To update a **PhraseList** element in the VCD file, get the **CommandSet** element that contains the phrase list.
trans-unit.target: To update a **PhraseList** element in the VCD file, get the **CommandSet** element that contains the phrase list.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Name** attribute of that **CommandSet** element (**Name** must be unique in the VCD file) as a key to access the [**VoiceCommandManager.InstalledCommandSets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653257) property and get the [**VoiceCommandSet**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653258) reference.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Name** attribute of that **CommandSet** element (**Name** must be unique in the VCD file) as a key to access the [**VoiceCommandManager.InstalledCommandSets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653257) property and get the [**VoiceCommandSet**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653258) reference.

trans-unit.source: Replace the phrase list
trans-unit.target: Replace the phrase list

trans-unit.source: After you've identified the command set, get a reference to the phrase list that you want to modify and call the [**SetPhraseListAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653261) method; use the **Label** attribute of the **PhraseList** element and an array of strings as the new content of the phrase list.
trans-unit.target: After you've identified the command set, get a reference to the phrase list that you want to modify and call the [**SetPhraseListAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653261) method; use the **Label** attribute of the **PhraseList** element and an array of strings as the new content of the phrase list.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you modify a phrase list, the entire phrase list is replaced.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you modify a phrase list, the entire phrase list is replaced.

trans-unit.source: If you want to insert new items into a phrase list, you must specify both the existing items and the new items in the call to [**SetPhraseListAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653261).
trans-unit.target: If you want to insert new items into a phrase list, you must specify both the existing items and the new items in the call to [**SetPhraseListAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653261).

trans-unit.source: Here, the VCD file defines a **Command**"showTripToDestination" with a **PhraseList** that defines three options for selecting a destination in our **Adventure Works** travel app.
trans-unit.target: Here, the VCD file defines a **Command**"showTripToDestination" with a **PhraseList** that defines three options for selecting a destination in our **Adventure Works** travel app.

trans-unit.source: As the user saves and deletes destinations in the app, the app updates the options in the **PhraseList**.
trans-unit.target: As the user saves and deletes destinations in the app, the app updates the options in the **PhraseList**.

trans-unit.source: Here's how to update the **PhraseList** shown in the previous example with an additional destination to Phoenix.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to update the **PhraseList** shown in the previous example with an additional destination to Phoenix.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Using a **PhraseList** to constrain the recognition is appropriate for a relatively small set or words.
trans-unit.target: Using a **PhraseList** to constrain the recognition is appropriate for a relatively small set or words.

trans-unit.source: When the set of words is too large (hundreds of words, for example), or shouldn’t be constrained at all, use the **PhraseTopic** element and a **Subject** element to refine the relevance of speech-recognition results to improve scalability.
trans-unit.target: When the set of words is too large (hundreds of words, for example), or shouldn’t be constrained at all, use the **PhraseTopic** element and a **Subject** element to refine the relevance of speech-recognition results to improve scalability.

trans-unit.source: In our example, we have a **PhraseTopic** with a **Scenario** of "Search", further refined by a **Subject** of "City\\State".
trans-unit.target: In our example, we have a **PhraseTopic** with a **Scenario** of "Search", further refined by a **Subject** of "City\\State".
